headline: Ganfeng Lithium expands into batteries as electric car stakes rise
snippet: Ganfeng Lithium, one of China’s fastest growing companies, is expanding into battery production as it seeks to prepare for the expected rapid growth in the country’s electric car market.

headline: Charged atmosphere Ganfeng Lithium IPO tests investor appetite as oversupply dilutes electric car battery demand
snippet: Ganfeng Lithium could raise up to $676m when it prices its shares on Wednesday. They start trading the followingweek.

headline: Trio of lithium IPOs will fuel debate on electric vehicles
snippet: US chemicals group FMC is set to spin-off its lithium business on the New York Stock Exchange while China’s two largest producers — Tianqi Lithium and Ganfeng Lithium — are due to list in Hong Kong.

headline: China’s BYD in talks over Chile lithium supply
snippet: Ganfeng Lithium, one of China’s largest producers, bought a 19.9 per cent stake in an Argentine project this year. The deal followed the purchase by Tianqi Lithium of a 2.1 per cent stake in SQM.

headline: Electric car trade likely to lose power
snippet: After stellar returns year-to-date shares of China’s biggest lithium producers Ganfeng Lithium and Tianqi Lithium have fallen almost 20 per cent cent over the past month.

headline: Powering the battery supply chain
snippet: Revenues for Ganfeng Lithium and its larger Shenzhen-listed rival Tianqi Lithium have risen from around $100m a year to over $1bn in a decade, joining the ranks of the largest producers.

headline: BHP energised to exploit new battery revolution
snippet: It has negotiated offtake agreements with China’s General Lithium and Jiangxi Ganfeng Lithium covering the entire 300,000 tonnes of concentrate production.

headline: Lithium bottlenecks threaten to fuel supercycle
snippet: The growing anxiety about supply comes as the production of lithium remains dominated by a handful of companies: Albemarle, Sociedad Química y Minera de Chile, and Chinese producers Tianqi Lithium and Ganfeng Lithium, which produce from Australia.
